intelligent_creatures.name: Dragonborn
intelligent_creatures.description: Dragonborn look very much like dragons standing erect in humanoid form, though they lack wings or a tail.

intelligent_creatures.name: Dwarf
intelligent_creatures.description: Bold and hardy, dwarves are known as skilled warriors, miners, and workers of stone and metal.

intelligent_creatures.name: Elf
intelligent_creatures.description: Elves are a magical people of otherworldly grace, living in the world but not entirely part of it.

intelligent_creatures.name: Gnome
intelligent_creatures.description: A gnomeâ€™s energy and enthusiasm for living shines through every inch of his or her tiny body.

intelligent_creatures.name: Half-Elf
intelligent_creatures.description: Half-elves combine what some say are the best qualities of their elf and human parents.

intelligent_creatures.name: Halfling
intelligent_creatures.description: The diminutive halflings survive in a world full of larger creatures by avoiding notice or, barring that, avoiding offense.

intelligent_creatures.name: Half-Orc
intelligent_creatures.description: Some half-orcs rise to become proud leaders of orc communities. Some venture into the world to prove their worth.

intelligent_creatures.name: Human
intelligent_creatures.description: Humans are the most adaptable and ambitious people among the common races.

intelligent_creatures.name: Tiefling
intelligent_creatures.description: To be greeted with stares and whispers, to suffer violence and insult on the street, to see mistrust and fear in every eye: this is the lot of the tiefling.

intelligent_creatures.name: Aarakocra
intelligent_creatures.description: Aarakocra are avian humanoids who live in high, mountainous regions.

intelligent_creatures.name: Aasimar
intelligent_creatures.description: Aasimar are humans with a celestial heritage, which shows through glowing eyes, a radiant aura, and feathered wings.

intelligent_creatures.name: Air Genasi
intelligent_creatures.description: Air Genasi are descended from djinn and have powers over air and wind.

intelligent_creatures.name: Bugbear
intelligent_creatures.description: Bugbears are large, hairy goblinoids known for their strength and stealth.

intelligent_creatures.name: Centaur
intelligent_creatures.description: Centaur are half-human, half-horse creatures known for their speed and archery skills.

intelligent_creatures.name: Changeling
intelligent_creatures.description: Changelings are shapeshifters capable of altering their appearance at will.

intelligent_creatures.name: Deep Gnome
intelligent_creatures.description: Deep gnomes, or svirfneblin, are subterranean cousins of gnomes known for their stealth and magic.

intelligent_creatures.name: Duergar
intelligent_creatures.description: Duergar are gray-skinned dwarves with a penchant for slavery and psionic powers.

intelligent_creatures.name: Earth Genasi
intelligent_creatures.description: Earth Genasi have powers over earth and stone, often displaying rock-like skin.

intelligent_creatures.name: Eladrin
intelligent_creatures.description: Eladrin are elves with a strong connection to the Feywild, allowing them to teleport and wield fey magic.

intelligent_creatures.name: Fairy
intelligent_creatures.description: Fairies are small, winged creatures known for their mischievous behavior and magical abilities.

intelligent_creatures.name: Firbolg
intelligent_creatures.description: Firbolg are gentle giants who live in harmony with nature, possessing magical abilities.

intelligent_creatures.name: Fire Genasi
intelligent_creatures.description: Fire Genasi are descended from efreet and have powers over flame and heat.

intelligent_creatures.name: Githyanki
intelligent_creatures.description: Githyanki are militaristic warriors from the Astral Plane, often wielding silver swords.

intelligent_creatures.name: Githzerai
intelligent_creatures.description: Githzerai are monks and psionicists who dwell in the chaos of Limbo.

intelligent_creatures.name: Goblin
intelligent_creatures.description: Goblins are small, cowardly creatures known for their cunning and love of mayhem.

intelligent_creatures.name: Goliath
intelligent_creatures.description: Goliaths are large, nomadic humanoids known for their strength and endurance.

intelligent_creatures.name: Harengon
intelligent_creatures.description: Harengon are rabbit-like humanoids with strong legs and keen senses.

intelligent_creatures.name: Hobgoblin
intelligent_creatures.description: Hobgoblins are militaristic goblinoids known for their discipline and tactical prowess.

intelligent_creatures.name: Kenku
intelligent_creatures.description: Kenku are crow-like humanoids known for their mimicry and stealth.

intelligent_creatures.name: Kobold
intelligent_creatures.description: Kobolds are small, cowardly creatures who often serve stronger creatures as minions.

intelligent_creatures.name: Lizardfolk
intelligent_creatures.description: Lizardfolk are reptilian humanoids who live in swamps and jungles, known for their primal instincts.

intelligent_creatures.name: Minotaur
intelligent_creatures.description: Minotaurs are bull-headed humanoids known for their brute strength and love of battle.

intelligent_creatures.name: Orc
intelligent_creatures.description: Orcs are aggressive humanoids who live for battle and conquest.

intelligent_creatures.name: Satyr
intelligent_creatures.description: Satyrs are hedonistic creatures with the lower bodies of goats and the upper bodies of humans.

intelligent_creatures.name: Sea Elf
intelligent_creatures.description: Sea Elves are ocean-dwelling elves known for their mastery of the sea and underwater realms.

intelligent_creatures.name: Shadar-kai
intelligent_creatures.description: Shadar-kai are shadowfell natives who possess a connection to darkness and death.

intelligent_creatures.name: Shifter
intelligent_creatures.description: Shifters are humanoids with bestial traits, capable of tapping into their primal instincts.

intelligent_creatures.name: Tabaxi
intelligent_creatures.description: Tabaxi are feline humanoids known for their agility, curiosity, and love of treasure.

intelligent_creatures.name: Tortle
intelligent_creatures.description: Tortles are humanoid turtles known for their resilience and natural armor.

intelligent_creatures.name: Triton
intelligent_creatures.description: Tritons are aquatic humanoids devoted to protecting the oceans and their denizens.

intelligent_creatures.name: Water Genasi
intelligent_creatures.description: Water Genasi are descended from marids and have powers over water and ice.

intelligent_creatures.name: Yuan-ti
intelligent_creatures.description: Yuan-ti are snake-like humanoids known for their cunning and mastery of deception.

intelligent_creatures.name: Kender
intelligent_creatures.description: Kender are small, curious creatures known for their fearlessness and knack for finding trouble.

intelligent_creatures.name: Astral Elf
intelligent_creatures.description: Astral Elves are elves with a strong connection to the Astral Plane, granting them knowledge of the cosmos.

intelligent_creatures.name: Autognome
intelligent_creatures.description: Autognomes are mechanical gnomes created by artificers, known for their inventiveness and precision.

intelligent_creatures.name: Giff
intelligent_creatures.description: Giffs are hippopotamus-like humanoids known for their militaristic society and love of firearms.

intelligent_creatures.name: Hadozee
intelligent_creatures.description: Hadozee are simian sailors known for their agility and ability to swing through the rigging.

intelligent_creatures.name: Plasmoid
intelligent_creatures.description: Plasmoids are amorphous creatures made of sentient, gelatinous material.

intelligent_creatures.name: Thri-kreen
intelligent_creatures.description: Thri-kreen are insectoid humanoids known for their speed, agility, and psychic abilities.

intelligent_creatures.name: Owlin
intelligent_creatures.description: Owlins are owl-like humanoids known for their wisdom and keen eyesight.

intelligent_creatures.name: Cervan
intelligent_creatures.description: Cervans are deer-like humanoids known for their grace and connection to nature.

intelligent_creatures.name: Corvum
intelligent_creatures.description: Corvums are raven-like humanoids known for their intelligence and dark magic.

intelligent_creatures.name: Gallus
intelligent_creatures.description: Gallus are chicken-like humanoids known for their cowardice and affinity for the arcane.

intelligent_creatures.name: Hedge
intelligent_creatures.description: Hedges are hedgehog-like humanoids known for their defensive spines and burrowing ability.

intelligent_creatures.name: Jerbeen
intelligent_creatures.description: Jerbeens are jerboa-like humanoids known for their speed and agility.

intelligent_creatures.name: Luma
intelligent_creatures.description: Lumas are moth-like humanoids known for their luminous wings and magical abilities.

intelligent_creatures.name: Mapach
intelligent_creatures.description: Mapachs are raccoon-like humanoids known for their dexterity and mischievous nature.

intelligent_creatures.name: Raptor
intelligent_creatures.description: Raptors are velociraptor-like humanoids known for their ferocity and pack tactics.

intelligent_creatures.name: Strig
intelligent_creatures.description: Strigs are owl-like humanoids known for their wisdom and mastery of illusion magic.

intelligent_creatures.name: Vulpin
intelligent_creatures.description: Vulpins are fox-like humanoids known for their cunning and agility.

normal animals.name: cat
normal animals.description: Small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur, a short snout, and retractile claws.

normal animals.name: Dog
normal animals.description: Domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, and a barking, howling, or whining voice.

normal animals.name: Horse
normal animals.description: Large hoofed mammal with a flowing mane and tail, used for riding, racing, and to carry and pull loads.

normal animals.name: Cow
normal animals.description: Large domesticated ruminant mammal with a distinctively humped back and horns, often raised for meat and dairy products.

normal animals.name: Sheep
normal animals.description: Domesticated ruminant mammal typically kept as livestock, valued for its wool and meat.

normal animals.name: Pig
normal animals.description: Domesticated hoofed mammal with sparse bristly hair and a flat snout, raised for meat.

normal animals.name: Chicken
normal animals.description: Domesticated fowl, a subspecies of the red junglefowl, raised for its meat and eggs.

normal animals.name: Duck
normal animals.description: Waterfowl with a broad blunt bill, short legs, webbed feet, and a waddling gait.

normal animals.name: Goose
normal animals.description: Large waterfowl with a long neck, short legs, and webbed feet, known for its honking call.

normal animals.name: Rabbit
normal animals.description: Small, furry mammal with long ears and a short tail, known for its hopping gait.

normal animals.name: Fox
normal animals.description: Carnivorous mammal with a pointed snout, bushy tail, and a coat typically reddish-brown in color.

normal animals.name: Wolf
normal animals.description: Carnivorous mammal closely related to the domestic dog, known for its pack behavior and howling vocalizations.

normal animals.name: Bear
normal animals.description: Large omnivorous mammal with a heavy build, thick fur, and a short tail.

normal animals.name: Deer
normal animals.description: Hoofed ruminant mammal with antlers in the males of most species, known for its graceful movements.

normal animals.name: Elephant
normal animals.description: Large herbivorous mammal with a long trunk, ivory tusks, and large ears, known for its intelligence and memory.

normal animals.name: Giraffe
normal animals.description: Tall, long-necked herbivorous mammal with distinctive patches of color on its coat and ossicones on its head.

normal animals.name: Lion
normal animals.description: Large carnivorous feline mammal with a tawny coat, a tufted tail, and a majestic mane in males.

normal animals.name: Tiger
normal animals.description: Large carnivorous feline mammal with a striped coat, known for its strength and agility.

normal animals.name: Zebra
normal animals.description: Herbivorous mammal with distinctive black and white stripes on its coat, known for its social behavior.

normal animals.name: Kangaroo
normal animals.description: Marsupial mammal with powerful hind legs adapted for leaping, native to Australia.

normal animals.name: Penguin
normal animals.description: Flightless seabird with distinctive black and white plumage, known for its waddling gait.

normal animals.name: Polar Bear
normal animals.description: Large carnivorous bear adapted to life in the Arctic, known for its thick fur and white coloration.

normal animals.name: Panda
normal animals.description: Bear native to China characterized by its distinctive black and white coat and bamboo diet.

normal animals.name: Monkey
normal animals.description: Primate with a long tail and opposable thumbs, known for its intelligence and playful behavior.

normal animals.name: Squirrel
normal animals.description: Small rodent with a bushy tail, known for its habit of storing nuts in the ground.

normal animals.name: Raccoon
normal animals.description: Nocturnal mammal with distinctive facial markings and a ringed tail, known for its intelligence and dexterity.

normal animals.name: Hedgehog
normal animals.description: Small spiny mammal with a rounded body and short legs, known for curling into a ball when threatened.

normal animals.name: Owl
normal animals.description: Nocturnal bird of prey with large forward-facing eyes, silent flight, and a hooked beak.

normal animals.name: Eagle
normal animals.description: Large predatory bird with a hooked beak and strong talons, known for its keen eyesight and powerful flight.

normal animals.name: Falcon
normal animals.description: Bird of prey with long, pointed wings and a notched beak, prized for its hunting prowess.

normal animals.name: Seagull
normal animals.description: Medium to large seabird with long wings and a distinctive cry, often found near coastal areas.

normal animals.name: Crow
normal animals.description: Black passerine bird known for its intelligence, adaptability, and distinctive cawing calls.

normal animals.name: Swan
normal animals.description: Large waterfowl with a long neck and typically all-white plumage, known for its grace and beauty.

normal animals.name: Pelican
normal animals.description: Large waterbird with a distinctive pouched bill and a long throat, known for its exceptional fishing skills.

normal animals.name: Dolphin
normal animals.description: Highly intelligent aquatic mammal known for its playful behavior and communication abilities.

normal animals.name: Shark
normal animals.description: Large predatory fish with a cartilaginous skeleton, sharp teeth, and a streamlined body.

normal animals.name: Octopus
normal animals.description: Marine mollusk with a soft body, eight sucker-bearing arms, and a beak-like mouth, known for its intelligence and camouflage abilities.

normal animals.name: Crocodile
normal animals.description: Large semiaquatic reptile with a long snout, sharp teeth, and a powerful tail, known for its ambush hunting style.

normal animals.name: Turtle
normal animals.description: Reptile with a bony or leathery shell into which it can retract its head and limbs, known for its slow movement.

normal animals.name: Snake
normal animals.description: Long, legless reptile with a cylindrical body and flexible jaws, known for its venomous species and constriction abilities.

normal animals.name: Frog
normal animals.description: Amphibian with a short body, long hind legs, and a distinctive call, typically found in moist environments.

normal animals.name: Salamander
normal animals.description: Amphibian with a slender body, long tail, and moist skin, known for its ability to regenerate lost body parts.

normal animals.name: Toad
normal animals.description: Amphibian with a stout body, short legs, and dry warty skin, typically found in drier habitats than frogs.

normal animals.name: Typhon
normal animals.description: Monstrous serpentine giant and the most deadly creature in Greek mythology.

creatures.name: Bahamut
creatures.description: Whale monster in Arabic mythology whose body supports the earth. Possibly the origin of the word Behemoth in Judeo-Christian lore.

creatures.name: Bake-kujira
creatures.description: Ghost whale in Japanese folklore.

creatures.name: Cetus
creatures.description: Monster with the head of a boar or greyhound, the body of a whale or dolphin, and a divided, fan-like tail in Greek mythology.

creatures.name: Devil Whale
creatures.description: Whale capable of swallowing ships in English folklore.

creatures.name: Encantado
creatures.description: Shapeshifting trickster dolphins in Brazilian folklore.

creatures.name: Glashtyn
creatures.description: Horse goblin from the sea in Celtic folklore.

creatures.name: Makara
creatures.description: Half terrestrial animal in the frontal part and half aquatic animal in the hind part in Hindu mythology.

creatures.name: Mug-wamp
creatures.description: Giant sturgeon monster said to inhabit Lake Temiskaming in Ontario, Canada, in Canadian folklore.

creatures.name: Sea Goat
creatures.description: Half goat, half fish creature in Greek mythology.

creatures.name: Selkie
creatures.description: Shapeshifting seal people in Scottish folklore.

creatures.name: Water Bull
creatures.description: Nocturnal amphibious bull in Scottish folklore.

creatures.name: Water Horse
creatures.description: General name for mythical water dwelling horses found in many cultures.

creatures.name: Ceffyl DÅµr
creatures.description: Water horse in Welsh mythology.

creatures.name: Each-uisge
creatures.description: Malevolent shapeshifting oceanic water horse in Scottish folklore.

creatures.name: Enbarr
creatures.description: Manann's horse, capable of traversing land and sea in Irish mythology.

creatures.name: Hippocampus
creatures.description: Horse with a fish tail in Greek mythology.

creatures.name: Ichthyocentaurs
creatures.description: Upper body of a man, lower front of a horse, tail of a fish in Greek mythology.

creatures.name: Kelpie
creatures.description: Water horse in Scottish folklore.

creatures.name: Morvarc'h
creatures.description: Legendary horse that could gallop on the waves in Breton folklore.

creatures.name: Nixie
creatures.description: Shapeshifting water being known for appearing as horses in Germanic folklore.

creatures.name: Nuckelavee
creatures.description: Skinless oceanic water horse with pestilent breath in Orcadian folklore.

creatures.name: Nuggle
creatures.description: Mischievous male water horse in Scottish folklore.

creatures.name: Tangie
creatures.description: Shapeshifting sea water horse in Scottish folklore.

creatures.name: Anansi
creatures.description: Trickster spider in West African folklore.

creatures.name: Arachne
creatures.description: Skilled mortal weaver who challenged Athena and was transformed into a spider in Greek mythology.

creatures.name: Basilisk
creatures.description: Legendary reptile with a lethal gaze or breath in European mythology.

creatures.name: Broxa
creatures.description: Bogeyman of the Brox, a marshy area near York, England, in English folklore.

creatures.name: Camanchee
creatures.description: Two-headed dragonfly said to have been seen in the West Indies, particularly in Jamaica, in Caribbean folklore.

creatures.name: Cenobites
creatures.description: Order of demons in Clive Barker's Hellraiser universe.

creatures.name: Charybdis
creatures.description: Whirlpool monster that swallows ships in Greek mythology.

creatures.name: CuÃ©lebre
creatures.description: Giant serpent-dragon from Asturian mythology.

creatures.name: Drider
creatures.description: Spider-like creature, combining drow and spider traits, in Dungeons & Dragons.

creatures.name: Elverman
creatures.description: House spirit in Swedish folklore that sometimes appears as a giant spider.

creatures.name: Giant Spiders
creatures.description: Enormous spiders found in various mythologies and fantasy literature.

creatures.name: Jba Fofi
creatures.description: Giant spider reported from the Congo.

creatures.name: Kumo
creatures.description: Giant spider in Japanese mythology.

creatures.name: Mermecolion
creatures.description: Imaginary creature with the body of an ant and the head of a lion.

creatures.name: Mongolian Death Worm
creatures.description: Large worm reported to inhabit the Gobi Desert.

creatures.name: Nalusa Falaya
creatures.description: Chickasaw spider monster that kidnaps and eats small children in Native American folklore.

creatures.name: Nephilim
creatures.description: Giant offspring of angels and humans in Judeo-Christian mythology.

creatures.name: PÃºca
creatures.description: Shapeshifting creature often seen as a giant insect in Irish folklore.

creatures.name: RÃ¡kshasa
creatures.description: Demon-like beings with supernatural powers in Hindu mythology.

creatures.name: Sandman
creatures.description: Mythological character said to sprinkle sand in the eyes of sleeping children to bring on dreams.

creatures.name: Scorpion Man
creatures.description: Mythical creature with the head of a human and the body of a scorpion in Mesopotamian mythology.

creatures.name: Shelob
creatures.description: Giant spider antagonist in J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth legendarium.

creatures.name: Stymphalian Birds
creatures.description: Man-eating birds with beaks of bronze and sharp metallic feathers in Greek mythology.

creatures.name: Tarasque
creatures.description: Legendary dragon with six short legs like a bear's, an ox-like body covered with a turtle shell, and a scorpion's tail in French folklore.

creatures.name: Tatzelwurm
creatures.description: Dragon or dragon-like cryptid reported in various Alpine countries.

creatures.name: Tsuchigumo
creatures.description: Mythical creature, possibly spider-like, from Japanese folklore.

creatures.name: Umi Bozu
creatures.description: Giant sea monster from Japanese folklore.

creatures.name: Ushi-oni
creatures.description: Ox-headed, spider-like yokai from Japanese mythology.

creatures.name: Yara-Ma-Yha-Who
creatures.description: Small, red, frog-like creature from Australian Aboriginal mythology.

items.name: Argus Panoptes
items.description: Hundred-eyed giant in Greek mythology, serving as a watchman for Hera.

items.name: Cadmus
items.description: Legendary founder of Thebes and slayer of the Ismenian Dragon in Greek mythology.

items.name: Geryon
items.description: Three-bodied giant, son of Chrysaor and Callirrhoe, slain by Heracles in Greek mythology.

items.name: Ladon
items.description: Hundred-headed dragon that guarded the golden apples in the Garden of the Hesperides in Greek mythology.

items.name: Pegasus
items.description: Winged divine horse in Greek mythology.

items.name: Polyphemus
items.description: Cyclops encountered by Odysseus in Homer's Odyssey.

items.name: Python
items.description: Serpent, dragon, or dragon-like creature in Greek mythology.

items.name: Sphinx
items.description: Mythological creature with the head of a human, wings of an eagle, and body of a lion, often depicted as female in Greek mythology.

items.name: Typhon
items.description: Monstrous serpentine giant and the most deadly creature in Greek mythology.
